main event: A bright light, brighter than the moon, was observed for about 30 minutes. The object resembled a parachute and was maneuvering and changing elevation.
interesting points: The object was not identified as an aircraft or star, and its movement was described as slow and in a straight line.
The object appeared to be yellow and luminous, and was sighted coming from the sea and moving from northeast to southwest.
The observer used a telescope, described as a 'child type used to study stars and moon', to observe the object.
Surface wind conditions at various altitudes were provided in the report.
The report suggests the object could have been a polar orbital satellite or one of the new intelligence orbital balloons.
sighted object: a bright light, brighter than the moon, resembling a parachute
witnesses: a truck driver and a student
